channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Can You Tone Down Your Tech?
item.description: A wake-up call for AI innovators

item.title: Meta just bought one of the fastest-growing AI startups you’ve probably never heard of
item.description: In a year defined by companies pouring shocking sums of money into AI , one more deal squeaked in just before 2026. Meta just made a play on Manus, th...

item.title: No, the White House can’t defund the CFPB, judge says, just days before agency would run out of cash
item.description: At the heart of this case is whether budget bigwig Russell Vought can effectively shut down the agency and lay off all of the bureau's employees.

item.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, granddaughter of JFK and cousin of Health Secretary RFK Jr., dies of cancer at 35
item.description: Her death comes just weeks after she publicly revealed in The New Yorker that she had been diagnosed with acute myeloid leukemia.

item.title: Doctors Without Borders kicked out of Gaza: Israel suspends dozens of humanitarian organizations over new registration rules
item.description: Israel says the rules are aimed at preventing Hamas and other militant groups from infiltrating the aid organizations.

item.title: Buddhist monks peace-walking from Texas to DC persist even after being run over on highway outside Houston
item.description: One of the monks had “substantial leg injuries” and was flown by helicopter to a hospital in Houston, Dayton Interim Police Chief Shane Burleigh said.

item.title: Open AI Might Change App Design Forever
item.description: WIth OpenAI’s new app store now open, design execs at Canva, Figma, Adobe, and Target explain their first integrations into ChatGPT and answer the que...

item.title: U.S. consumer watchdog faces extinction in 2026 as Trump says it’s ‘very important’ to shut it down
item.description: When Bianca Jones, a 33-year-old special education teacher in Memphis, Tennessee, decided a couple of years ago that she wanted to buy a house, she st...

item.title: USDA announces ground beef recall over E. coli concerns
item.description: Packages of grass fed ground beef are being recalled over possible E. coli contamination. The affected packages were distributed in at least six state...

item.title: Why Silver Prices Surged, Then Dropped Overnight
item.description: Safe-haven demand, industrial use, and dollar weakness fueled the rally—but profit-taking may be kicking in.

item.title: AI agents 2025 recap: What happened and what to expect next year
item.description: In artificial intelligence , 2025 marked a decisive shift. Systems once confined to research labs and prototypes began to appear as everyday tools. At...

item.title: An AI super-bull who just backed the Nvidia-Groq deal warns of a data center bust: ‘We foresee a significant financial crisis’
item.description: Alex Davis says third-party data-center developers will eventually be jilted by the hyperscalers they serve, and face a subsequent debt crisis.

item.title: Judge rules White House must continue to fund CFPB
item.description: The White House cannot lapse in its funding of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau , a federal district court judge ruled on Tuesday, only days b...

item.title: Yes, You Can Launch Your Own Investment Fund
item.description: Here’s what it takes, in five steps.

item.title: Stocks Are Cool Again
item.description: How YouTubers, apps, and algorithms brought Wall Street to Gen Z.
